library(glue)
library(stringr)
library(magrittr)

# Adds a page break
PageBreak <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("\\pagebreak") }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("<div style='page-break-before: always;' />") }
  }

# Displays the macOS CMD button symbol (as a keyboard button)
macOSCmdButton <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("\\keys{\\cmd}") }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("<span class='key'>&#8984;</span>") }
  }

# Displays a label as a keyboard button
KeyboardButton <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    { knitr::asis_output(paste0("\\keys{", label, "}")) }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output(glue("<span class='key'>{label}</span>")) }
  }

# Formats a label inside of a warning/tip/note section to LaTeX.
# Supports bold, italic, inline code (which should use \x60 in place of backticks),
# and newlines.
MarkdownSectionFormatLabel <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
               # convert markdown bold tags
    label %<>% stringr::str_replace_all("\\*\\*([\\w ()-]{1,})\\*\\*",
                                        "\\\\textbf{\\1}") %>%
               # italics
               stringr::str_replace_all("\\*([\\w ()-]{1,})\\*",
                                        "\\\\textit{\\1}") %>%
               # inline code
               stringr::str_replace_all("`([\\w ()-]{1,})`",
                                        "\\\\texttt{\\1}") %>%
               # newlines
               stringr::str_replace_all("\n", "\\\\newline ")
    knitr::asis_output(label)
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output(label) }
  }

# Begins a "Warning" section with a label. can be embedded in.
# Call EndSection() after you have entered your content for the section.
# Note that the fontawesome5 LaTeX package should be installed.
BeginWarningSection <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste(
      "\\begin{tcolorbox}[colframe=lightgray,colback=lightpink,arc=3mm]",
      "\n\\faExclamationTriangle \\textbf{Warning} \\newline"))
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("::: {.warning}") }
  }

# Begins a "Tip" section with a label. can be embedded in.
# Call EndSection() after you have entered your content for the section.
BeginTipSection <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste(
      "\\begin{tcolorbox}[colframe=lightgray,colback=lightyellow,arc=3mm]",
      "\n\\faLightbulb[regular] \\textbf{Tip} \\newline"))
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("::: {.tip}") }
  }

# Begins a "Note" section with a label. can be embedded in.
# Call EndSection() after you have entered your content for the section.
BeginNoteSection <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste(
      "\\begin{tcolorbox}[colframe=lightgray,colback=lightyellow,arc=3mm]",
      "\n\\faComment*[regular] \\textbf{Note} \\newline"))
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("::: {.note}") }
  }

# Ends a notes/tip/warning section
EndSection <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output("\n\\end{tcolorbox}")
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output("\n:::")
    }
  }

This book is a guide to using the software product **Readability Studio**, as well as a reference for readability formulas. For those interested in the formulas, please refer to the [English](#english-readability-tests), [Spanish](#spanish-readability-tests), and [German](#german-readability-tests) formula overviews. For further reading, refer to the [bibliography](#bibliography) for a concise list of articles discussing these formulas.
